title: Forecasting temperature at your vacation destination
text: name network France “FR__ASOS”. already know ’s one airport near city.
code: library("riem") library("dplyr") france_airports <- riem_stations(network = "FR__ASOS") marseilles_airport <- filter(france_airports, grepl("MARSEILLE", name) | grepl("Marseille", name)) marseilles_airport ## # A tibble: 1 × 22 ##   index id    synop name  country elevation network online plot_name archive_end ##   <int> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr>       <dbl> <chr>   <lgl>  <chr>     <chr>       ## 1    69 LFML  99999 Mars… FR             36 FR__AS… TRUE   MARSEILL… NA          ## # ℹ 12 more variables: modified <chr>, spri <int>, tzname <chr>, iemid <int>, ## #   archive_begin <chr>, metasite <lgl>, wigos <chr>, longitude <dbl>, ## #   latitude <dbl>, state <chr>, lon <dbl>, lat <dbl>

what: Get time series of temperature for Marseille airport
title: Forecasting temperature at your vacation destination
text: ’ll transform daily average, convert Fahrenheit Celsius thanks weathermetrics package. impute missing values remove outliers via use forecast::tsclean.
code: marseille <- riem_measures(station = marseilles_airport$id,                            date_start = "2010 01 01")  marseille <- group_by(marseille, day = as.Date(valid)) marseille <- summarize(marseille, temperature = mean(tmpf)) marseille <- mutate(marseille, temperature = weathermetrics::fahrenheit.to.celsius(temperature)) library("ggplot2")   library("forecast") marseille_ts = ts(as.vector(tsclean(marseille$temperature)), freq=365.25, start=c(2010, 1)) autoplot(marseille_ts) +   ylab("Daily average temperature in Marseille airport (ºC)") +   xlab("Time (days)")

title: Forecasting temperature at your vacation destination
text: use forecast package. use stlm time series obviously present yearly seasonality.  Mmh don’t see anything, autoplot.forecast include parameters, ’ll plot last 31 values.
code: fit <- stlm(marseille_ts) pred <- forecast(fit, h = 7) # plot theme_set(theme_gray(base_size = 14)) autoplot(pred) +   ylab("Daily average temperature in Marseille airport (ºC)") +   xlab("Time (days)") +   ggtitle("How cold will I be during the holidays?",           subtitle = "Data accessed via the rOpenSci riem package and forecasted with forecast") autoplot(pred, include = 31) +   ylab("Daily average temperature in Marseille airport (ºC)") +   xlab("Time (days)") +   ggtitle("How cold will I be during the holidays?",           subtitle = "Data accessed via the rOpenSci riem package and forecasted with forecast")

what: What if I went somewhere else?
title: Forecasting temperature at your vacation destination
text: Ok, travelled , say, Hyderabad India?  Without surprise, forecast ’d enjoyed warmer weather. wouldn’t advise really use code forecast temperature, ’d recommend use riem getting weather airport data quite easily dig deeply forecast functionalities ’re interested time series forecasting. stay warm!

title: riem
text: Possible variables (copied , see also ASOS user guide) station: three four character site identifier valid: timestamp observation (UTC) tmpf: Air Temperature Fahrenheit, typically @ 2 meters dwpf: Dew Point Temperature Fahrenheit, typically @ 2 meters relh: Relative Humidity % drct: Wind Direction degrees north sknt: Wind Speed knots p01i: One hour precipitation period observation time time previous hourly precipitation reset. varies slightly site. Values inches. value may may contain frozen precipitation melted device sensor estimated means. Unfortunately, know authoritative database denoting station sensor. alti: Pressure altimeter inches mslp: Sea Level Pressure millibar vsby: Visibility miles gust: Wind Gust knots skyc1: Sky Level 1 Coverage skyc2: Sky Level 2 Coverage skyc3: Sky Level 3 Coverage skyc4: Sky Level 4 Coverage skyl1: Sky Level 1 Altitude feet skyl2: Sky Level 2 Altitude feet skyl3: Sky Level 3 Altitude feet skyl4: Sky Level 4 Altitude feet presentwx: Present Weather Codes (space seperated), see e.g. manual explanations. feel: Apparent Temperature (Wind Chill Heat Index) degF ice_accretion_1hr: Ice Accretion 1 Hour inch ice_accretion_3hr: Ice Accretion 3 Hour inch ice_accretion_6hr: Ice Accretion 6 Hour inch relh: Relative Humidity % metar: unprocessed reported observation METAR format peak_wind_gust: Wind gust knots METAR PK WND remark, value may different value found gust field. gust field derived standard METAR wind report. peak_wind_drct: wind direction degrees North denoted METAR PK WND remark. peak_wind_time: timestamp PK WND value timezone valid field controlled tz parameter. conversion wind speed temperature units, see package.
